abstract: Bookstores bounce back, the Kindle Fire falls a little flat and Chelsea Clinton makes her NBC debut.
snippet: Bookstores bounce back, the Kindle Fire falls a little flat and Chelsea Clinton makes her NBC debut.
lead_paragraph: Bookstores have reported an unexpectedly strong beginning to the Christmas shopping season, lifted by “an unusually vibrant selection,” Julie Bosman writes. It has been a strong year for nonfiction, some booksellers pointed out, starting with the Steve Jobs biography by Walter Isaacson. However, the increased business is also a product of the closing of the Borders Books chain, whose customers are visiting other stores to do their book shopping. Overall sales will take a hit from the loss of Borders.

abstract: Jerry Sandusky’s autobiography is no longer available from Amazon, but that is not stopping would-be reviewers, who are piling on with sarcastic reviews.
snippet: Jerry Sandusky’s autobiography is no longer available from Amazon, but that is not stopping would-be reviewers, who are piling on with sarcastic reviews.
lead_paragraph: In an earlier era, crowds might have massed in State College, Pa., to vocally proclaim their displeasure at Jerry Sandusky, the former Penn State coach charged with many counts of sexual abuse of young boys. Now, in one of the less-anticipated developments of e-commerce, the mobs gather online to vent while Christmas shopping.
